@graph.headline: Shopify Collabs: A Guide to NOT Giving Away Your Store Keys
@graph.description: Log in to your Shopify Partners dashboard. Go to the “Stores” section. Click the “Add store” button, then select “Request access to store.” Enter the store’s URL and choose the permissions you need. You can also add a custom message. Click “Send request” to notify the store owner. If you need to hire a developer, […]
@graph.keywords: shopify, collaborator, access, permissions, security, partners, dashboard, staff, accounts, developers

about.name: Shopify Collaborator Access
about.description: A secure system for granting external partners access to Shopify store backend without sharing login credentials

about.name: Shopify Partners Dashboard
about.description: Platform used by developers and agencies to manage client stores and request collaborator access

about.name: Staff Accounts
about.description: Internal team accounts for employees who are part of day-to-day operations

about.name: Collaborator Accounts
about.description: External partner accounts for freelancers, agencies, and consultants hired for specific tasks

mainEntity.name: Can I limit what a collaborator can see and do after I've approved them?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. As the store owner, you can edit a collaborator's permissions at any time by going to Settings > Users and permissions.

mainEntity.name: Why is this better than a staff account again?

acceptedAnswer.text: It's more secure, it creates a clearer audit trail for external partners, and it doesn't use up one of your paid staff slots, which can save you money.

mainEntity.name: Can a developer just request access without me knowing?

acceptedAnswer.text: They can send a request at any time, but they will never be granted access unless you, the store owner, explicitly approve it. You are always in control.

@graph.name: Collaborator Access
@graph.description: A secure system that allows external partners to access specific parts of a Shopify store without sharing login credentials

@graph.name: Least Privilege
@graph.description: Security principle of granting only the minimum access necessary to complete a task
